title: Move _CompiledMixin to C++
body_html: Moves the JIT hot path to C++. Removes around 10-15us from the LSTM benchmark (155us -> 140us), but should be possible if we manage to remove the parameters() call and move the logic for handling implicitly captured variables to C++ (that call costs another 10-15us at least, even for a single module).
body_text: Moves the JIT hot path to C++. Removes around 10-15us from the LSTM benchmark (155us -> 140us), but should be possible if we manage to remove the parameters() call and move the logic for handling implicitly captured variables to C++ (that call costs another 10-15us at least, even for a single module).
body: Moves the JIT hot path to C++. Removes around 10-15us from the LSTM benchmark (155us -> 140us), but should be possible if we manage to remove the `parameters()` call and move the logic for handling implicitly captured variables to C++ (that call costs another 10-15us at least, even for a single module).
